meanings.definition: The property by which a being exists of and from itself.
meanings.sent1: The aseity of the ancient deity was unquestionable.
meanings.sent2: Philosophers often discuss the concept of aseity in relation to existence.
meanings.sent3: The aseity of the cat's ability to open doors amazed the family.
meanings.sent4: Her aseity shone through her actions, showing her independence.
meanings.sent5: The aseity of the mountain, standing tall and proud, was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Self-existence; the quality of being self-derived or self-originated.
meanings.sent1: The philosopher pondered the idea of aseity late into the night.
meanings.sent2: The concept of aseity is central to the discussion of existence.
meanings.sent3: The aseity of the tree's growth made the gardener smile.
meanings.sent4: His aseity in decision-making set him apart from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The aseity of the river flowing endlessly symbolized eternal life.
